common_issues.title: Ollama Installation Failure on Linux
common_issues.description: Users on Linux, particularly in snap-based environments, are experiencing failures when installing Ollama through the Pieces desktop app. This is due to a missing 'curl' dependency in the snap package. A fix has been implemented and is expected to be released shortly. Users are advised to update their Pieces installation once the fix is available.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points & Problems:**

* Pieces tries to use `curl` which is not guaranteed to be installed in snap-based environments.
* This leads to Ollama installation failures and inference issues.
* Pieces needs to add `curl` to the snap dependency packages and adjust its behavior for snap environments.

**Proposed & Implemented Solutions:**

* Patch implemented to allow access to Ollama from a snap.
* Fix to address the `curl` dependency missing in the snap package.
* Infrastructure updates completed to allow resumption of work on the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Fix scheduled for release in the upcoming week (as of January 23, 2025).
* Users still experiencing issues as of January 28, 2025.
* No immediate workaround available as the issue impacts both downloads and inference.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was caused by a miscommunication regarding confinement level of the Pieces package.
* Users are advised to update their Pieces installation as soon as the fix is released.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Github Issue Summary: High Memory and CPU Usage of Pieces Operating System

**Key Points Raised:**

* Several users reported high memory and CPU usage of PiecesOS, especially after using it for a while.
* Issues were observed on various operating systems like Windows, Linux, and macOS.
* Memory usage was reported to be as high as 5GB, even when the tool was not actively used.
* CPU usage also spiked, sometimes reaching 120% on powerful machines.
* This caused system slowdowns and interfered with workflow.

**Problems Identified:**

* Leaky memory management.
* Inefficient use of resources due to live context feature.
* Potential for heavy database technologies to exacerbate the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Optimize memory usage feature to unload unused models.
* Implement live context toggle to reduce RAM usage.
* Replace heavy database technologies with lighter alternatives in version 11.1.0.
* Further fixes planned for future releases.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Version 11.1.0 released to address memory and CPU issues.
* Users encouraged to report feedback on the effectiveness of the update.
* Continued development of further optimizations planned.

**Additional Notes:**

* Some users reported continued issues after the update.
* The exact cause of the problem is still under investigation.
* The development team is actively working on improvements.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (CPX10) reported an issue with automatic updates for Pieces Core Services and Pieces Desktop App on PiecesOS 11.0.
* User mentioned similar issues reported by others (GitHub issue references provided).
* Pieces Support Bot suggested relevant resources and related issues.
* Pieces Support Team confirmed the issue and tagged relevant engineers for further investigation.
* Engineer (@mack-at-pieces) requested a live video call to troubleshoot the issue.
* Engineer identified the issue as being related to using the Microsoft Store distribution channel, which doesn't support in-app updates yet.
* Engineer provided two workarounds: quitting/re-opening the apps or updating from the Microsoft Store.
* Pieces team acknowledged the need for a more intuitive update experience for Microsoft Store builds.
* Issue closed.

**Problems Identified:**

* Automatic updates for Pieces software not working on Microsoft Store installation.
* Lack of intuitive update experience for Microsoft Store builds.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Live video call to troubleshoot the issue (offered by engineer).
* Workarounds provided: quit/re-open the apps or update from the Microsoft Store.
* Pieces team acknowledged the need for a more intuitive update experience for Microsoft Store builds (future improvement).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed.
* Workarounds available until Microsoft Store update experience is improved.

## GitHub Issue Summary: "POS Not Working with New Port"

**Key points raised:**

* Raju-git20 reports POS not working after upgrade to 11.0.0 despite using the new port 39300 (as suggested by the bot). Screenshots provided.
* Mark-at-pieces mentions POS uses a range of ports based on the `com.pieces.os/production/config/.port.txt` file.
* Raju-git20 clarifies they are using the port specified in the port file.
* Raju-git20 also shares they are building a Python code for LinkedIn scraping and application using AI and wants to schedule a call for feedback.

**Problems identified:**

* POS not functioning with the new port (39300), despite the provided instructions.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces clarifies the port range used by POS and the port-finding algorithm.
* Mark-at-pieces expresses interest in learning more about Raju-git20's project and offers to connect them with relevant people at Pieces.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Raju-git20 provided their project description and requested a call to schedule a feedback session, which was approved and a link to Mark-at-pieces' calendar was provided.
* Outcome of the call and further troubleshooting regarding the port issue are unknown as the conversation ends here.

**Additional notes:**

* The user's project involves scraping and applying for positions on LinkedIn using AI, indicating potential automation functionalities.
